formal agreement and peace between countries and people: nations living in concord Compare

language
  specialized the situation in which the words in a sentence match each other according to the rules of grammar, for example when the verb is plural because the subject of the sentence is plural

Linguistics: grammatical terms
the capital city of the US state of New Hampshire: The composer grew up in Concord, New Hampshire and took clarinet lessons from his father. A snowmobiler was pulled to safety today after he plunged into a pond near Concord, New Hampshire.
More examplesFewer examplesShe grew up in Concord.He spent five years working as a nurse in Concord.She joined us from the studios of New Hampshire Public Radio in Concord.Route 4 is "antiques alley" from the coast to Concord, NH.
